title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

We are looking for the application of the relationship between the increasing and decreasing behavior of the first derivative and the points of inflection of the original function.

The first point is earned for “none,” with some relevant mathematical discussion.

The reasoning point is most commonly earned by correctly appealing to the decreasing behavior of g ′ . MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaceWGNbGbauaacaGGUaaaaa@34DE@

An appeal to g ″ MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaceWGNbGbayaaaaa@342D@ must address the consideration of both g ″ =0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaceWGNbGbayaacqGH9aqpca aIWaaaaa@35ED@ and g ″ MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaceWGNbGbayaaaaa@342D@ undefined.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

Make sure the response addresses the average value of g ′ , MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaceWGNbGbauaacaGGSaaaaa@34DC@ not of g.

The Fundamental Theorem of Calculus point is earned for the expression g ( 8 )−g ( 0 ). MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGNbGaaGjcVpaabmaaba GaaGioaaGaayjkaiaawMcaaiabgkHiTiaadEgacaaMi8+aaeWaaeaa caaIWaaacaGLOaGaayzkaaGaaiOlaaaa@3E5B@

The answer point is earned only for the correct answer. The values of 10 and − 6 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacqGHsislcaaMi8UaaGOnaa aa@3672@ must be shown.

1 8 ( 10−( − 6 ) ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaadaWcaaqaaiaaigdaaeaaca aI4aaaamaabmaabaGaaGymaiaaicdacqGHsisldaqadaqaaiabgkHi TiaayIW7caaI2aaacaGLOaGaayzkaaaacaGLOaGaayzkaaaaaa@3D73@ earns both points.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

The student must establish that g is a continuous function. The most common, and acceptable, response is “differentiable implies continuous.”

The student must convey that differentiability implies continuity. Stating g is differentiable and continuous, does not earn the first point.

The response that mentions continuity without establishing continuity is still eligible for the second point.

Using, or citing, the Mean Value Theorem will not earn the second point.

To earn the second point the student must explicitly convey an appropriate inequality involving 0, either mathematically or in words. For example, − 6<0<10 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacqGHsislcaaMi8UaaGOnai abgYda8iaaicdacqGH8aapcaaIXaGaaGimaaaa@3AA9@ or g ( 0 )<0<g ( 8 ). MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGNbGaaGjcVpaabmaaba GaaGimaaGaayjkaiaawMcaaiabgYda8iaaicdacqGH8aapcaWGNbGa aGjcVpaabmaabaGaaGioaaGaayjkaiaawMcaaiaac6caaaa@4030@

The second point requires an answer of “yes” or an equivalent statement.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

Some (incorrect) responses claim that evaluation of the integrand is equal to the value of the integral.

The first point requires demonstration of both the sum of integrals and the multiplication by a constant.

2 ⋅ 28.8+5 ⋅ 8 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaaIYaGaaGjbVdbaaaaaaa aapeGaeyyXICTaaGjbVlaaikdacaaI4aGaaiOlaiaaiIdacqGHRaWk caaI1aWdaiaaysW7peGaeyyXICTaaGjbVlaaiIdaaaa@444C@ earns both points. This is the minimal supporting work required.

title: Part E
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

The minimal supporting computations required are − 6−1 sin 0−1 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaadaWcaaqaaiabgkHiTiaayI W7caaI2aGaeyOeI0IaaGymaaqaaiGacohacaGGPbGaaiOBaiaaysW7 caaIWaGaeyOeI0IaaGymaaaaaaa@3EF1@ or − 6−1 0−1 . MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaadaWcaaqaaiabgkHiTiaayI W7caaI2aGaeyOeI0IaaGymaaqaaiaaicdacqGHsislcaaIXaaaaiaa c6caaaa@3B3E@ Either of these alone would earn the point.

The student does not have to evaluate sin 0. MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaaciGGZbGaaiyAaiaac6gaca aMe8UaaGimaiaac6caaaa@3905@

An answer of just “7” does not earn the point because it does not show the minimal computations.

title: Part F
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

A response of only e x  ⋅ g ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGLbWaaWbaaSqabeaaca WG4baaaOGaaGjbVdbaaaaaaaaapeGaeyyXICTaaGjbV=aacaWGNbGa aGjcVpaabmaabaGaamiEaaGaayjkaiaawMcaaaaa@3FE8@ earns only the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus point.

Some responses may reverse the limits of integration and state this is equal to the original integral. This incorrect approach could earn only the first two points, but will not earn the answer point, unless the student resolves the limits reversal issue.

The answer point can only be earned if both of the first two points are earned, and the given answer is correct.

1 ⋅ ( −28.8 )+1 ⋅ ( − 6 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaaIXaGaaGjbVdbaaaaaaa aapeGaeyyXICTaaGjbVpaabmaabaGaeyOeI0IaaGOmaiaaiIdacaGG UaGaaGioaaGaayjkaiaawMcaaiabgUcaRiaaigdapaGaaGjbV=qacq GHflY1caaMe8+aaeWaaeaacqGHsislcaaMi8UaaGOnaaGaayjkaiaa wMcaaaaa@4AC2@ earns all three points.

title: Part G
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

If the student writes the integral with x ⋅  g ′  ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG4bGaaGjbVdbaaaaaaa aapeGaeyyXICTaaGjbV=aaceWGNbGbauaacaaMi8+aaeWaaeaacaWG 4baacaGLOaGaayzkaaaaaa@3ED3@ as the integrand, we need to see that it is equal to the integral with A ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGbbGaaGjcVpaabmaaba GaamiEaaGaayjkaiaawMcaaaaa@3811@ for the integrand.

So, ∫ 0 8 A ( x )  dx = ∫ 0 8 x ⋅  g ′  ( x )  dx MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaadaWdXaqaaiaadgeacaaMi8 +aaeWaaeaacaWG4baacaGLOaGaayzkaaGaaGPaVlaaykW7caWGKbGa amiEaaWcbaGaaGimaaqaaiaaiIdaa0Gaey4kIipakiabg2da9maape dabaGaamiEaiaaysW7qaaaaaaaaaWdbiabgwSixlaaysW7paGabm4z ayaafaGaaGjcVpaabmaabaGaamiEaaGaayjkaiaawMcaaiaaykW7ca aMc8UaamizaiaadIhaaSqaaiaaicdaaeaacaaI4aaaniabgUIiYdaa aa@5601@ earns the point.

Some responses introduce another variable, or function, for example, R ( x )= g ′  ( x ), MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGsbGaaGjcVpaabmaaba GaamiEaaGaayjkaiaawMcaaiabg2da9iqadEgagaqbaiaayIW7daqa daqaaiaadIhaaiaawIcacaGLPaaacaGGSaaaaa@3EE7@ before writing the final expression in terms of this other variable. This earns the point. For example, A ( x )=x ⋅ R ( x ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGbbGaaGjcVpaabmaaba GaamiEaaGaayjkaiaawMcaaiabg2da9iaadIhacaaMe8oeaaaaaaaa a8qacqGHflY1caaMe8+daiaadkfacaaMi8+aaeWaaeaacaWG4baaca GLOaGaayzkaaaaaa@4495@ in the presence of R ( x )= g ′  ( x ). MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGsbGaaGjcVpaabmaaba GaamiEaaGaayjkaiaawMcaaiabg2da9iqadEgagaqbaiaayIW7daqa daqaaiaadIhaaiaawIcacaGLPaaacaGGUaaaaa@3EE9@

The point is not earned if the correct integrand appears only in part (h).

title: Part H
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

If there is no integration by parts, no points are earned in this part.

The integration by parts point is for an “indefinite integration by parts.” The bounds are associated with the answer point.

Minimal work required to earn the integration by parts point: 8 ⋅ 10−0−28.8 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPj MCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaac H8rrps0lbbf9q8WrFfeuY=Hhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xbba9q8WqFf ea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9Fve9Ff0dmeaa baqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaaI4aGaaGjbVdbaaaaaaa aapeGaeyyXICTaaGjbVlaaigdacaaIWaGaeyOeI0IaaGimaiabgkHi TiaaikdacaaI4aGaaiOlaiaaiIdaaaa@4075@
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes both of the criteria below.

title: Part I
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.

Many students will write the antiderivative without any evidence of substitution. This antiderivative must be completely correct to earn the substitution point.

Limit notation must be used in order to earn the improper integral point.

The student must earn the improper integral point to be eligible for the answer point.

If the student uses an explicit substitution and makes an error in the limits, they cannot earn the answer point.

A response can earn the substitution point for working only with an indefinite integral.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes two of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes all three of the criteria below.
